intro: Cienkowskia nitida, commonly known as the slender cienkowskia, is a rare and endangered plant species native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It is a deciduous shrub characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested habitats. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is critically endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival. Its unique botanical features make it an important subject for botanical research and ecological studies.
